image.altText: A building in the city.

props.synopsis: Hobart is well-known for its heritage buildings and low city skyline, but an urban strategist says the city needs to build up to improve livability.

title.children: In this capital city only 15 per cent of dwellings are units. Experts say it has to change or the city will 'stall by sprawl'

image.altText: People stand around a car with all its doors open with a sign in beg letters on the wall behind reading BYD

props.synopsis: Chinese-made electric cars are gaining popularity as a cheaper alternative to brand names like Tesla, and Australia is benefiting from the increased supply.

title.children: Cheaper Chinese electric cars are making their way into Australia, but it's not all good news

image.altText: A court sketch shows Hunter Biden sitting in court.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden becomes the first child of a sitting US president to be convicted of a crime after he's found guilty of three gun charges that could see him jailed.

title.children: 'I will always be there for Hunter': Joe Biden's show of support after jury convicts his son

image.altText: Max Giuliani holds up his hand

props.synopsis: Max Giuliani could have been a tradie had his Tasmanian coach not moved to the Gold Coast. Now he's heading to the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

title.children: How a move from Tassie made sense for Max with massive time gains and an Olympic spot

image.altText: Kerry Whiting.

props.synopsis: A court hears from a young man who, while attempting to stop his mother being stabbed, caught sight of the alleged attacker who "looked me dead in the face … and I saw it was my father".

title.children: Court told of moment teenager grabbed murder accused who 'looked me dead in the face and I saw that it was my father'

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: Huge demand and lack of supply paint a grim picture for anyone saving to buy their first home, analysts warn.

title.children: 'Astronomical' property price growth to continue for foreseeable future, say analysts

image.altText: A split image shows two men wearing suits, one older with a tie, one younger

props.synopsis: The horrible truth is that in the Australian legacy media landscape, there are too many stories of senior men who forgive themselves their own lapses of judgement, or forgive each other's because they're "good blokes", or go easy on each other because they fear a nuclear escalation.

title.children: The shamelessness of powerful men in Australia's media industry knows no bounds

image.altText: Bridget Archer in the House of Representatives during a debate to censure Scott Morrison

props.synopsis: Liberal MP Bridget Archer says it would be a "regressive" step if the Coalition abandoned the legislated 2030 climate target, defying her party leader.

title.children: Liberal MP says Peter Dutton's plan to abandon 2030 climate target is 'regressive', and other colleagues are concerned

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a row of gloved hands holding up COVID-19 vaccines.

props.synopsis: Many Australians are preparing to head overseas and interstate these school holidays. Medical experts reveal how long before their travel they should be getting a booster.

title.children: How far in advance should I get a COVID-19 booster before travelling? Here's what the experts say

image.altText: Unidentified child's hands playing with building bricks.

props.synopsis: Parents earning more would be asked to pay $30 for three days of care. The estimated cost to the government would be $7 billion a year.

title.children: Free or cheap child care for all families: New report recommends major overhaul

image.altText: Silver energy electricity box

props.synopsis: The body that sets the rules in Australia's biggest electricity markets acknowledges worries about complex power prices as it launches review.

title.children: Top energy watchdog flags power pricing revamp as concerns grow over complex tariffs

image.altText: Katya Daniel sits on the ground beside a white tent on a sunny day and breastfeeds her baby.

props.synopsis: About one in five breastfeeding mothers suffer from mastitis, but experts say not enough research exists on treatment for this common condition.

title.children: When Katya developed a common condition associated with breastfeeding, she struggled to find information

image.altText: Clothing website Shein is shown on a computer screen, and online retailer Temu is shown on  mobile phone screen.

props.synopsis: Ultra-fast fashion is so last year in Europe. France has moved to curb sales of mass-produced clothes. Could Australia follow suit?

title.children: Calls for Australia to follow France as it gets set to tax ultra-fast fashion

image.altText: A composite image of a young family and an older man with grey hair.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has delivered a big spending pre-election budget, with billions in cost-of-living relief. Is it enough to win votes?

title.children: Queensland is spending big on cost of living. Is it enough to win hearts and minds?

image.altText: A logo of a school on a white building with trees in the back.

props.synopsis: About 50 students from Bacchus Marsh Grammar have reported images of their faces were used to create fake nude photos generated by AI. Police are investigating after the images of the girls, aged as young as 13, were circulated online.

title.children: 'It's appalling': Melbourne principal slams fake nude photos of female students believed to be generated using AI

image.altText: A man in a patterned blue shirt looks at someone out of shot

props.synopsis: In an address to the nation, Malawi's President Lazarus Chakwera confirmed that all 10 passengers on board died.

title.children: Malawi's vice-president and nine others killed in plane crash

image.altText: A flight attendant posing inside a plane.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of employees of embattled budget airline Bonza are told their employment has been officially terminated at an online meeting.

title.children: 'I just feel heartbroken': Sacked staff from collapsed airline Bonza chase their entitlements

image.altText: A man in a shirt, tie and jacket stands with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Sampson engaged high-profile barristers Arthur Moses SC and Sue Chrysanthou SC, and solicitor Rebekah Giles to represent him, before reaching the confidential settlement.

title.children: Former Cranbrook headmaster reaches settlement with school over resignation 'confusion'

image.altText: Model pic sent to scam victims

props.synopsis: In the Dubai desert lies a scam factory capable of swindling tens of thousands of people at a time. But one scammer has a secret plan that could shut the whole syndicate down.

title.children: Inside a secret scam factory where workers pretend to be glamorous models

image.altText: White haired man in cheetah pattern jacket holding black and white photo

props.synopsis: This week marks 60 years since The Beatles first and only tour of Australia and New Zealand. Former rock'n'roller Johnny Devlin recalls what it was like opening for the Fab Four.

title.children: Johnny Devlin treasures his photo with The Beatles — a reward for fixing sound issues

image.altText: A sepia image of Eric Collier holding a guitar, standing, smiling with Janine Garvey in black, smiling in front of house

props.synopsis: South Gippsland musicians Eric Collier and Janine Garvey head up the band No Promises, which has penned an open letter to the Australian music industry imploring them to "just listen". Their new song Singing My Lines asks why the industry hasn't so far.

title.children: There should be no 'expiry date' for good music or women in the industry, says Aussie band

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Prosecuting lawyers are making their final arguments in the murder trial of former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn, who is charged with the murder of Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: 'A series of lowlights': Defence lawyers for Greg Lynn take aim at prosecution case in Supreme Court murder trial

image.altText: CCTV of two young men looking around a home

props.synopsis: More than 40,000 Queenslanders want Castle Law to use lethal force against home intruders, but the law society says existing laws allowing reasonable force have served the community well.

title.children: 'Criminals will fight back': Proposed new law allowing people to kill home intruders not perfect, victim warns

image.altText: An arched gateway with Chinese writing and red lanterns on it, pink flowers out of focus in the foreground

props.synopsis: A suspect has been arrested over the stabbing of four American college teachers in north-eastern China, police say, with Beijing describing the attack as an "isolated" incident.

title.children: Suspect arrested over stabbing of four American teachers in China

image.altText: An image of the Northern Territory Supreme Court building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: CCTV footage of the fatal stabbing of Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty is played in court on day two of the murder trial of Keith Kerinauia, who is accused of murdering Mr Laverty at a BWS bottle shop in March 2023.

title.children: Keith Kerinauia murder trial hears witness accounts of bottle shop worker's fatal stabbing

image.altText: Kusini Yengi kicks the ball towards the goal past two Palestinian defenders and a goalkeeper

props.synopsis: Australia ends the current phase of World Cup qualifying with six wins from as many matches after defeating Palestine 5-0 in Perth.

title.children: Yengi stars as Socceroos beat Palestine 5-0

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown gives thumbs up

props.synopsis: Kayley McKeown is undoubtedly backstroke swimming's present and foreseeable future, but a glimpse of Australia's not-so-distant past was also on view on day two of the Australian Olympic Trials in Brisbane — as well as a glimpse at an alternate future.

title.children: McKeown swims second-fastest time in history in 100m backstroke

image.altText: two people are looking at each other, a man is standing at a bar smiling, the woman is sitting, smiling and pointing at him.

props.synopsis: The leap from real life to the screen can be messy and content creators can find themselves in hot water in pursuit of 'real-life' storytelling.

title.children: 'Based on a true story': Netflix's Baby Reindeer and the blurry lines between fact and fiction

image.altText: Michael Mosley speaks on a morning talk show wearing a blazer, blue shirt and glasses

props.synopsis: British TV presenter Michael Mosley died of natural causes, with a post-mortem examination finding no evidence of foul play.

title.children: 'He very nearly made it': TV doctor Michael Mosley died from natural causes after 'incredible climb', his wife says

image.altText: A man with grey curly hair wears a white face mask.

props.synopsis: A British judge who recently resigned from Hong Kong's top court warns the territory is "slowly becoming a totalitarian state" with its rule of law "profoundly compromised."

title.children: 'Profoundly compromised': Concerns over rule of law sees British judge quit Hong Kong's top court

image.altText: group of people walking down jetty at Moreton Bay

props.synopsis: City of Moreton Bay council says an investigation has been launched into how names, addresses, phone numbers and complaint details were accidentally published online.

title.children: Resident shocked as private ratepayer information published to council website

image.altText: A man on a motorbike taking part in Finke Desert Race.

props.synopsis: NT Police have revealed further details of a Finke Desert Race campfire explosion which left six Victorian men with significant burns.

title.children: Group 'sprayed with boiling oil' after shock absorber explodes at Finke Desert Race campsite

image.altText: A composite of two women dressed in jijabs, one standing in front of a maple tree

props.synopsis: The Sydney Malayalee Community confirm the identities of two women who were swept into the ocean over the long weekend.

title.children: Sydney's Indian community mourning as two women 'swept off the rocks by freak wave'

image.altText: Woman standing in front of a mural of herself.

props.synopsis: As Caitlin Foord prepares for her third Olympics, a stunning 14-metre-high mural in Wollongong celebrates her journey. The mural captures her dynamic style and features her beloved dog, Peach, inspiring young athletes to dream big.

title.children: 'Pinch me moment': Matildas star honoured with a 14-metre mural in her home town of Wollongong
